ch.keybridge.lib.identicon

Class NineBlockIdenticonRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.keybridge.lib.identicon.NineBlockIdenticonRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IdenticonRenderer

    public class NineBlockIdenticonRenderer
extends Object
implements IdenticonRenderer
    9-block Identicon visual hash renderer.

    An Identicon is a visual representation of a hash value, usually of an IP address, that serves to identify a user of a computer system as a form of avatar while protecting the users' privacy.

    This (original) Identicon is a 9-block graphic, and the representation has been extended to other graphic forms by third parties.

    This is refactored / renamed from the NineBlockIdenticonRenderer2 class file.

    This implementation uses only the lower 32 bits of the input identicon code.

    Since:
    1.0.0 created 06/01/2016
    Author:
    Don Park donpark@docuverse.com, Jesse Caulfiled

      • setPatchSize

        public final void setPatchSize(double patchSize)
        Set the size in pixels at which each patch will be rendered before they are scaled down to requested output image size.

        Default size is 20 pixels which means, for a 9-block image a 60x60 image will be rendered and scaled down.

        Parameters:
        patchSize - the patch size in pixels
